body:
Comment 11 by **xianrenb**: 
Comment 10 does not make any sense.
Who could say the standard library must have no bug and could not be changed before
ANOTHER release?
If you guys run "gofmt" before every commit only, I would strongly recommend adding
another run before every release to make sure that the codes always match the latest
version of "gofmt".
And again, if coding style in the standard library is considered to be standard, go
programmers would certainly want an automated tool to format their own code in standard
style. The tool should be "gofmt".
Yes, this issue is closed as WAI by you guys, but people could still leave their
comments. People could still check the reasons and judgement made after many many years
by searching in "issues".
